text:
Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 12:08 pm John Terry could leave Chelsea this summer after 22 years at the club (Picture: Getty) 
Asmir Begovic believes John Terry has the ability and fitness to continue playing at Chelsea beyond the current season. 
Terry, who has spent over 22 years at Stamford Bridge, will be out of contract in the summer and is expected to leave the club. 'We have major interest' - Club break silence as Chelsea open talks for £70m star 
The former England star has been forced to adopt a more limited role under Antonio Conte and has not started a Premier League game since September. 
Terry featured for only the third time in 2017 at the weekend as the Blues beat Wolves 2-0 in the fifth round of the FA Cup. 
But goalkeeper Begovic reckons the 36-year-old is capable of continuing his professional career next term. 
‘I can see him continuing to play and while he is playing like this, I don’t see why he should quit,’ Begovic told the Evening Standard . Ex-England man Terry was offered a rare start against Wolves in the FA Cup (Picture: Getty) 
‘He trains every day, he’s as fit as a fiddle and you don’t get the sense that he is coming to an end. 
‘What he has in his mind and what he is planning to do is something only he can answer. 
‘But if he collects two trophies [the League and FA Cup], maybe that’s a great way to go out. Who knows?’ 
Terry is keen to get into management following the end of his playing career and is currently taking his coaching badges. 
But Begovic insists his Chelsea team-mate has the ability to carry on at the top level – should that be his wish. Chelsea fixtures
